name: Non-Alcoholic Malort Milk Stout
instructions: In a large pitcher, combine cold brew concentrate, milk, malt syrup, cocoa powder, molasses, and vanilla extract. Whisk or use an immersion blender to fully dissolve.
Carefully add wormwood extract or gentian tincture, a few drops at a time, tasting as you go to achieve desired bitterness.
Add a pinch of salt to enhance flavors. Adjust sweetness with more malt syrup or lactose if needed.
Chill for at least 1 hour to let flavors meld.
Serve in a stout glass over a large ice cube if desired. Garnish with cocoa powder or grated dark chocolate for effect.

tasting_notes.aroma: Roasty cold brew, chocolate malt, sharp herbal bitterness.
tasting_notes.flavor: Sweet malt and milk up front, creamy mouthfeel, rising wormwood bitterness.
tasting_notes.mouthfeel: Thick, velvety, dessert-like but with a bitter punch.
